result.execSummary:
The defendant G T Fleming was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
(Case called at 10:17 AM) Defendant G T Fleming appears in person. ADA Loralee Clark appears in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court advises the Defendant that the case was amended to an ordinance and the Defendant was defaulted for costs only. Defendant agrees wit the resolution.

9:53 AM Prosecuting attorney Afton Brianna Lewis Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant G T Fleming not in court. State moves to amend Count 2 to a County Ordinance Disorderly Conduct. Victim/Witness statute complied with. Court grants State's Motion and amends Count 1. No contest plea is entered on defendant's behalf and the Court finds the Defendant guilty. Court orders court costs. Anything else is ordered dismissed and read in.
CK 43537 mailed to defendant; signature bond ordered, bail posted refunded.

Conditions:
No contact with Motel 6 in Eau Claire County.

(11:02 AM case called.) Defendant G T Fleming in court without counsel. Attorney Afton Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advises he was told someone from the Public Defender's Office would be here to assist him.
Court has defendant take a seat and will recall the case once representation has arrived.
(11:31 AM case recalled.) Defendant G T Fleming in court with Attorney Sonia L Anderson. Attorney Afton Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant acknowledges receipt of the complaint.
Defendant updates address and phone number with the Court.
Pre-Trial Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on January 24, 2022 at 2:45 pm.
  Hearing scheduled for February 15, 2022 at 09:30 am.
